Our monthly employee newsletter with company updates and announcements -----
July 2023 Edition

Welcome to the Latest Edition of 
The Justia Insider

Hey there, Justians! Are you ready for another edition of The Justia Insider? Can you feel the buzz of change as we embrace September and autumn is almost around the corner? Big kudos for your unwavering dedication and spirited involvement across all our projects, which have paid off. Your contributions mean a lot. Any comments or questions? Let us know!

Milestones & Accomplishments

Let’s Find Out What’s Been Achieved So Far by Our Teams at Justia

Marketing Blasts. We continue streamlining our email marketing processes for everyone's benefit. We've introduced a performance report for campaigns, offering valuable insights. Also, we're now sending a weekly digest version of our Justia Webinar recording blasts.

Justia Elevate. We continue improving Justia Elevate with regular updates and features, including version upgrades for WordPress and the Yoast SEO plugin, support for YouTube shorts, and titles for FAQ stripes, among other improvements.

Justia Elevate. We added the Full-Text Search to our client's websites and new versions for Header, Footer, and Contact Form Stripes to display the Search form to improve our Justia Elevate platform. We also added new versions for the Quarter goals for the Basic Stripe with credit card payment options and a different look and feel for the Client Reviews Stripe.

QA Automation. We've made significant enhancements to our Automated QA workflow. This includes automating the release notes protocol and restructuring the backend code for quicker development, ensuring smoother processes and faster deliverables.

IT Team. While our IT Team is deeply engaged in a complex backend migration for our Jweb clients, they also actively manage routine infrastructure maintenance. This includes maintenance for properties such as JLD, client blogs, Justia Elevate, Justia Dockets, and more.

Data Team. Our Data Team compiled a report on the performance of both the Justia Ask A Lawyer sidebar widget and the Justia Ask A Lawyer sticky footer, providing insights valuable to both technical and non-technical teams.

Regulations. Following our regular schedule, we have now published the quarterly version of all U.S. state regulations.

YouTube Link. We've updated most of our web properties to include a link to our YouTube channel in the footer section alongside other social media links. Like and subscribe!

JUSTIA PORTAL NEWS

Take a Look at the Ongoing Development of Our Consumer Portal

  • More 50-State Surveys. We worked on surveys on death penalty laws for the Constitutional Law Center, state income tax laws for the Tax Law Center, sex offender registration rules for the Criminal Law Center, and consumer protection laws for the Consumer Protection Law Center.
  • Justia Legal Dictionary. We implemented a new strategy for the forthcoming Justia Legal Dictionary as we learned more about how OpenAI works.

  • Blog Posts. We continued to contribute to our Justia Legal News blog with articles about intriguing recent cases in areas such as trademark registration and copyright infringement.

NEW TEAM MEMBERS

Getting to Know the New Talent at Justia

David Lopez

Front-End Team

Hi everyone! I'm David Lopez, and I come from Saltillo, Coahuila. I'm 25 years old and work as a computer systems engineer. I really believe that it's important to share knowledge rather than keeping it to ourselves. I enjoy trying out new tech stuff, cooking, watching and playing sports, and listening to music. I'm super excited about joining this team and ready to take on whatever challenges come my way!

Roye Bustan

Engineering Team Intern

Hello, my name is Roye Bustan! I am 27 years old and from Los Angeles, California. I graduated from UCSD with a bachelor's in Applied Mathematics. I am a naturally curious and social person and love meeting new people. I enjoy surfing, traveling, and martial arts in my spare time! I am stoked to join Justia and excited to get to know you all!

upcoming holidays

Dates to Remember

U.S. Labor Day September 4th

Celebrated on the first Monday of September in the US, it honors the contributions of the American workforce and their role in the nation's prosperity. Originating from the late 19th-century labor movement, it symbolizes advancements in work conditions and wages. The holiday marks summer's end with parades and picnics and provides a well-deserved break while highlighting workers' rights and work-life balance.

Mexico’s Independence Day September 16th

On September 16, 1810, Miguel Hidalgo y Costilla, known as Father Hidalgo, initiated the call for autonomy, leading to Mexico's Independence Day—a nationally revered occasion. In over two centuries, September 16 has become a widespread celebration in Mexico, commemorating Father Hidalgo's initial advocacy for independence. Worldwide, individuals of Mexican heritage unite to honor their nation's liberation from Spanish rule.

REVIEWS & RECOMMENDATIONS

Somebody Somewhere

Available on HBO MAX

"Somebody Somewhere might not boast intricate intrigues, shocking unveilings, or gripping cliffhangers, yet it exudes a comforting sensitivity and profound compassion. The series reminds us that even if we don't quite align with the world around us, there will always be someone, somewhere, who helps us find our sense of belonging in their realm."

— Erika

Collaborators: Alejandra Medina, Alejandro Moreno, Arturo Jara, Erika Azuela, Genaro Osoria, Haydee Garcia, Jorge Contreras, Jose Ramos, Lauren Moskie, Miguel Berlanga, Omar Carreon, Rene Peralta, and Zoraida Vallejo.
